revised_title: Nitrogen-Substitution Compounds and New Alcohols: Griess's Discoveries
tldr: In this article, Peter Griess discusses his research on nitrogen-substitution compounds and new alcohols derived from them. He describes the synthesis of several new compounds, including nitrate of diazobenzol and nitrate of naphthylamin, and their properties and reactions. These discoveries expanded the understanding of nitrogen-substituted derivatives and their potential applications in chemistry.
